2019-07-28T12:59:17Z: Driver, TeamVerstappen, Red BullVettel, FerrariKvyat, Toro RossoStroll, Racing PointSainz, McLarenAlbon, Toro RossoRaikkonen, Alfa RomeoGrosjean, HaasGiovinazzi, Alfa RomeoMagnussen, Haas
2019-07-28T15:39:34Z: We'll let you have a breather now. The Hungarian Grand Prix is next up, and it's the final one before the summer break. Join us next weekend for the round in beautiful Budapest!
2019-07-28T15:38:25Z: And here's the report. It's taken a while to unpack, but if you fancy reliving a stunning race in written format, your best bet is here: Verstappen wins wild German GP from Vettel, disaster for MercedesMax Verstappen mastered both wet and dry conditions to win the 2019 Formula 1 German Grand Prix for Red Bull as Mercedes faltered badly at its home race
2019-07-28T15:24:26Z: When was the last time the podium had two Honda-powered drivers on it? Our own Scott Mitchell reckons it was Senna and Berger in the '92 Portuguese GP, but it depends if we count Mugen prefixes. If yes, then we can add '98 Belgium to that list, surely?
2019-07-28T15:21:37Z: What a breathtaking race that's been. On a weekend dominated with Mercedes's 125th motorsporting anniversary, the podium's occupied by two Honda-powered cars and a Ferrari car. Probably not what they planned.
2019-07-28T15:15:25Z: The last podium conversation between Vettel and Kvyat in the cooldown room was a lot different. A lot lot different.
2019-07-28T15:14:34Z: Kvyat also confirms that his baby was born last night - what a weekend. Congratulations to Dany and Kelly on the little one!
2019-07-28T15:12:15Z: Magnussen sneaks by the Vettel interview, presumably trying to avoid an irate Grosjean...
2019-07-28T15:10:03Z: What about that from Vettel too? P20 to P2. Lovely stuff.
2019-07-28T15:09:41Z: Sainz waits by the Toro Rosso mechanics to congratulate Kvyat. Former team-mates still with masses of respect for each other.
2019-07-28T15:09:05Z: Verstappen leaps out of his car and immediately into the arms of his team.
2019-07-28T15:08:45Z: Last time a Toro Rosso made the podium was Vettel's win in 2008 at Monza - in conditions much like this. Amazing effort from Kvyat.
2019-07-28T15:07:54Z: Holy smokes. Phenomenal race. Rain - the great equaliser. Albon got sixth, as the Alfas took seventh and eighth courtesy of Raikkonen and Giovinazzi. Grosjean and Magnussen, for all of their transgressions, complete the top 10.
2019-07-28T15:06:16Z: Vettel comes home second, with Kvyat, Stroll and Sainz not far behind.
2019-07-28T15:05:46Z: Max Verstappen wins a wild German GP for Red Bull.
2019-07-28T15:04:54Z: Verstappen is well clear of Vettel, with Kvyat looking safe in third.
2019-07-28T15:04:25Z: The Gasly/Albon incident is now under investigation.
2019-07-28T15:04:05Z: Vettel takes second from Kvyat with another DRS pass towards the hairpin - he started right at the back!
2019-07-28T15:03:16Z: That's Gasly! He tried to pass Albon and runs into the back of him! That's his day over.
2019-07-28T15:02:15Z: And indeed with the DRS advantage Vettel easily takes third on the run to the hairpin to the delight of the home crowd.
2019-07-28T15:01:31Z: DRS has been enabled - that's bad news for Stroll.
2019-07-28T15:01:14Z: Verstappen has now edged to a 2.1s lead over Kvyat.
2019-07-28T15:00:50Z: Vettel is now closing up to Stroll - could be late heartbreak for Racing Point.
2019-07-28T15:00:41Z: And that Grosjean/Magnussen kerfuffle is being looked at by the stewards. Crikey.
2019-07-28T15:00:12Z: Gasly tries an overtake on Albon, but the Thai driver has absolutely none of it!
2019-07-28T15:00:06Z: Kvyat has managed to stay just one-second behind Verstappen so far.
2019-07-28T14:59:44Z: But Vettel manages to recover and dives past Sainz at the hairpin to take fourth!
2019-07-28T14:59:14Z: Vettel is being pressured by Albon for P5.
2019-07-28T14:58:29Z: You know who's just two places away from the points? It's Kubica! Just Magnussen and Giovinazzi are the only cars in his way.
2019-07-28T14:58:23Z: The safety car is coming in - it'll be a five lap sprint to the flag.
2019-07-28T14:57:01Z: Here's the order with the safety car deployed again in this crazy race - Verstappen, Kvyat, Stroll, Sainz, Vettel, Albon, Gasly, Raikkonen, Grosjean, Giovinazzi, Magnussen, Kubica, Russell, Hamilton.
2019-07-28T14:55:18Z: Bottas had an near-identical incident to Hamilton - he lost the rear touching wet patch as he flew through Turn 1 - but unlike his team-mate he smashed into the barriers at the exit.
2019-07-28T14:53:46Z: Bottas has ripped the front end of his car off in the same place Hamilton went off a few laps ago - what a shambles for Mercedes!
2019-07-28T14:53:25Z: As if that's just happened! The two Haas drivers touch, wheel to wheel, at the hairpin!
2019-07-28T14:53:16Z: Bottas spins off at Turn 1 - he's out!
2019-07-28T14:52:54Z: Vettel is homing in on Sainz in P5 - the Ferrari driver is flying.
2019-07-28T14:51:58Z: We're onto lap 56 of 64 - can Kvyat and Stroll hang on to their podiums?
2019-07-28T14:51:31Z: Kvyat is now three seconds clear of Stroll in second place.
2019-07-28T14:51:12Z: Vettel's setting hugely-quick laps, as he's cleared Albon for sixth. Fastest lap remains his.
2019-07-28T14:50:46Z: Sainz is making it a three-way scrap for third in his McLaren.
2019-07-28T14:50:39Z: Hamilton pits, and he's now plum-last. Plum. Last.
2019-07-28T14:50:12Z: Raikkonen is past Magnussen for 10th, and is now going after Grosjean.
2019-07-28T14:50:09Z: Stroll has edged slightly clear of Bottas, but he's still under pressure.
2019-07-28T14:49:39Z: Hamilton rejoins just 5s clear of Kubica - who saw that coming?
2019-07-28T14:49:06Z: Hamilton's off! He has an off at turn 1, letting Giovinazzi through. Replay shows he has a big spin after touching the white line.
2019-07-28T14:47:14Z: Kvyat is already 1.5s clear of Stroll P2-P3.
2019-07-28T14:46:50Z: We've finally had a replay of Verstappen's pass on Stroll for the lead - it was an easy DRS pass on the run to the hairpin.
2019-07-28T14:46:42Z: Now it's a fastest lap for Vettel, who pinches it from Giovinazzi! A 1m17.590s for the Ferrari driver there.
2019-07-28T14:46:05Z: Bottas is now homing in on Stroll's third place.
2019-07-28T14:45:43Z: Kvyat eases into second with DRS on the run down to the hairpin - Kvyat is flying.
2019-07-28T14:45:25Z: Verstappen sets another fastest lap and increases his lead to eight seconds.
2019-07-28T14:45:09Z: Kvyat has caught Stroll and they're set to fight over P2.
2019-07-28T14:45:03Z: Albon surges up to sixth, passing Magnussen. Sainz is next up, if he can close in on him.
2019-07-28T14:44:08Z: Verstappen retakes the fastest lap up front - he's four seconds clear of Stroll.
2019-07-28T14:43:59Z: Albon's now right on Magnussen's tail for P6.
2019-07-28T14:43:33Z: Bottas runs fourth, but he's five seconds behind Kvyat, who currently holds the fastest lap for Toro Rosso.
2019-07-28T14:42:54Z: The leaders are Verstappen, Stroll and Kvyat - of course!
2019-07-28T14:42:25Z: Albon gets past Gasly once more! A great move at the hairpin, the Toro Rossos are flying at the moment.
2019-07-28T14:42:24Z: Hamilton has fallen to P12 as he had to serve his five-second penalty at his stop.
2019-07-28T14:42:00Z: And Versappen as indeed retaken the lead off-camera.
2019-07-28T14:41:49Z: Verstappen is right with Stroll - so it might not be a long lead for the Racing Point driver.
2019-07-28T14:41:21Z: So Stroll, yes, Stroll, now leads the German GP.
2019-07-28T14:41:03Z: Hamilton pits from the lead, as do Raikkonen and Vettel behind him.
2019-07-28T14:41:02Z: Stroll's played this brilliantly so far! He's up to fifth now, just ahead of Verstappen.
2019-07-28T14:40:24Z: A whole bunch come in for slicks too - Sainz, Gasly and Albon all file in.
2019-07-28T14:40:15Z: Stroll is ahead of Verstappen in the net lead of the race.
2019-07-28T14:39:54Z: Bottas comes in as well - but Hamilton had to stay out.
2019-07-28T14:39:06Z: Hamilton is swamped by Albon and Sainz at the hairpin - with Albon losing fifth to Sainz - but Hamilton just holds on to third.
2019-07-28T14:38:51Z: Kvyat and Magnussen immediately peel in, are they stopping for slicks?
2019-07-28T14:38:24Z: Verstappen absolutely left Bottas practically standing still at the restart - his lead is already 2.1s after one sector.
2019-07-28T14:37:49Z: And the race is back underway!
2019-07-28T14:37:27Z: Verstappen backs the pack up ahead of the restart.
2019-07-28T14:37:10Z: Stroll's popped on slicks - and with the pack so close, this could be all or nothing for Racing Point.
2019-07-28T14:36:26Z: This will be the final tour for the safety car - it's coming in at the end of the lap.
2019-07-28T14:35:48Z: The safety car remains out at the start of lap 45 of 64 - we're into the final 20 laps now.
2019-07-28T14:35:09Z: The drivers are seeking out the wet patches of the track where they can to cool their tyres.
2019-07-28T14:33:02Z: Hulkeberg's car is now being craned away - so we might be back racing soon.
2019-07-28T14:32:00Z: So Verstappen as lost his massive lead with this safety car, but he does have the advantage of fresh rubber over the Mercedes cars.
2019-07-28T14:31:37Z: Bit of a heartbreak for Hulkenberg. Those front tyres just weren't rotating at all; he'd just careened into an irreversible aquaplane. His first ever podium will have to wait.
2019-07-28T14:30:40Z: Verstappen is up to four pitstops for the day now.
2019-07-28T14:30:37Z: Vettel also peels in for new inters, and he's a little slow away.
2019-07-28T14:30:06Z: Verstappen retained the lead despite his stop.
2019-07-28T14:29:34Z: Replays show Hulkenberg understeered off, then had a slide and when he braked his car went straight-on over the drag strip and he hit the wall.
2019-07-28T14:28:23Z: Hulkenberg is in the barrier above the final corner!
2019-07-28T14:27:54Z: Giovinazzi is now right behind Raikkonen, who seems to have dusted himself off.
2019-07-28T14:27:30Z: Raikkonen goes off at the penultimate corner, the scene of Leclerc and Hamilton's scuffles! That lets Vettel and Gasly trickle through, as he rejoins.
2019-07-28T14:26:24Z: Verstappen sets the fastest lap up front.
2019-07-28T14:26:03Z: Just a reminder - all the cars are on intermediates.
2019-07-28T14:25:45Z: Gasly's back on Vettel's tail, having been cleared in short shrift by the German at the restart. Vettel's making no real inroads into Raikkonen, either.
2019-07-28T14:25:07Z: So here's how the lead fight is now poised - Verstappen leads Bottas by 8.4s, with Hamilton a further 2.3s back.
2019-07-28T14:24:21Z: And Hamilton takes third at the hairpin in a near-identical move to Bottas's.
2019-07-28T14:23:02Z: Hulkenberg will have Hamilton behind him anytime soon.
2019-07-28T14:22:41Z: Bottas takes second with a DRS-assisted dive at the hairpin!
2019-07-28T14:22:24Z: Verstappen's lead is now over eighth seconds in the lead.
2019-07-28T14:21:52Z: Bottas is all over Hulkenberg in the fight for P2.
2019-07-28T14:21:35Z: Hamilton passes Albon for fourth on the run out of the hairpin.
2019-07-28T14:21:13Z: Hamilton is under investigation for driving unnecessarily slowly behind the safety car.
2019-07-28T14:20:49Z: Kvyat's still really struggling into that hairpin, losing shedloads of time to Grosjean. This gives Giovinazzi license to scamper off into the distance.
2019-07-28T14:20:24Z: Verstappen already has a 5.3s lead over Hulkenberg.
2019-07-28T14:20:07Z: Albon is still ahead of Hamilton in fourth place - but the Mercedes is all over the Toro Rosso.
2019-07-28T14:18:33Z: Vettel has an immediate pop at Gasly, but then finds himself under fire from Giovinazzi.
2019-07-28T14:18:30Z: Hamilton is given a five-second time penalty for his incident at the pitlane entry.
2019-07-28T14:18:08Z: Albon has to defend hard at the hairpin from Hamilton.
2019-07-28T14:17:22Z: Verstappen has a lead of 1.9s after one sector.
2019-07-28T14:17:08Z: Verstappen drops Hulkenberg at the restart.
2019-07-28T14:16:48Z: And we're back racing at Hockenheim.
2019-07-28T14:15:51Z: The safety car will come in at the end of this lap and the race will resume at the start of lap 34 of 64.
2019-07-28T14:14:56Z: That Leclerc incident is a mixture of two things. One: the standing water completely removing the tyre/track contact. Two: the very slow nature meant that Leclerc had no downforce to speak of to collect the car back.
2019-07-28T14:13:23Z: Leclerc's crash is very similar to what Vettel did in the same race last year - a small moment had major consequences.
2019-07-28T14:12:42Z: Hamilton is under investigation for coming into the pitlane the wrong side of the entry bollard.
2019-07-28T14:12:06Z: A replay of Hamilton's incident shows he did almost exactly the same as Leclerc - slid off after a small moment and brushed the wall - but he had enough momentum to get out of the barrier.
2019-07-28T14:11:10Z: The top five is now Verstappen, Hulkenberg, Bottas, Albon and Hamilton.
2019-07-28T14:10:48Z: A lot of stops down the order, which have elevated Sainz - after his earlier excursion - back up to sixth. Wow.
2019-07-28T14:10:40Z: Verstappen has already come in for inters while the drama was unfolding at Mercedes - he's into the lead behind the safety car.
2019-07-28T14:10:05Z: Bottas pits under the safety car - he must be going back to inters.
2019-07-28T14:09:49Z: Hamilton has fallen down to fifth - despite being stationary for so long.
2019-07-28T14:09:20Z: Chaos down at Mercedes - looks like the team was going to put new dry tyres on but it changed its mind and fitted inters.
2019-07-28T14:08:37Z: Hamilton's incident happened off-screen, but it looks like he's gone off at the same place as Leclerc.
2019-07-28T14:08:18Z: Hamilton pits straight away but Mercedes aren't ready for him
2019-07-28T14:08:14Z: Vettel puts on the inters! It's just too wet now!
2019-07-28T14:07:57Z: Hamilton has gone off too! He's taken half of his front wing off!
2019-07-28T14:07:31Z: Replays show Leclerc lost it at pretty low speed approaching the final corners and just understeered into the barriers.
2019-07-28T14:06:13Z: Leclerc is stuck in the gravel - safety car deployed.
2019-07-28T14:05:46Z: Leclerc is into the wall at the penultimate turn!
2019-07-28T14:05:28Z: Hamilton has gone onto the softs - and he had a slow pitstop.
2019-07-28T14:05:13Z: Hamilton pits - just as the VSC ends!
2019-07-28T14:04:08Z: Leclerc pits for softs - and he comes out still ahead of Bottas and Verstappen.
2019-07-28T14:04:06Z: Norris has an off! He's pulling off, as Stroll has a spin!
2019-07-28T14:03:42Z: VSC deployed for the stricken cars.
2019-07-28T14:03:33Z: Raikkonen, Giovinazzi, Gasly and Grosjean all come in. All the G's.
2019-07-28T14:03:27Z: Verstappen has absolutely slated Red Bull for putting him on the mediums over his radio.
2019-07-28T14:02:56Z: Verstappen did a full 360 heading into the corners before the pitlane, but he was able to keep going.
2019-07-28T14:02:27Z: Verstappen spins in the final sector!
2019-07-28T14:01:55Z: Kvyat, Norris and Stroll all come into the pits for slicks.
2019-07-28T14:01:51Z: Replays show that Leclerc had to be very careful on the slippery drag strip as Verstappen was pitting.
2019-07-28T14:01:06Z: Personal best for Magnussen, that's a 1m31.378s last time out.
2019-07-28T14:00:45Z: It's medium tyres for Verstappen - what a gamble from Red Bull.
2019-07-28T14:00:23Z: Kubica comes in, presumably for some soft-grade slicks too.
2019-07-28T14:00:18Z: Red Bull looks like its preparing for a stop.
2019-07-28T13:59:48Z: Both Bottas and Verstappen are struggling for grip with their near-bald inters.
2019-07-28T13:59:44Z: A 1m32.279 for Magnussen - a way off of Leclerc's blinding opening intermediate lap, but on the current pace of the leaders.
2019-07-28T13:58:56Z: A green middle sector for Magnussen, too. It looks like the time is ripe for slicks.
2019-07-28T13:58:50Z: Leclerc is three seconds behind Verstappen - that VSC stop is still pay off as he was well behind before.
2019-07-28T13:58:31Z: Vettel's taken a set of softs too! Magnussen seems to have opened the floodgates for slicks.
2019-07-28T13:58:04Z: Well we were totally wrong about Verstappen passing Bottas this time around - he's struggling now he's in the dirty air.
2019-07-28T13:57:54Z: Not a representative time for Magnussen yet, but we're keeping a watchful eye on his sector times.
2019-07-28T13:56:47Z: Verstappen is all over Bottas in the fight for second - could well be a pass next time into the hairpin.
2019-07-28T13:56:13Z: Verstappen is now within DRS striking distance of Bottas
2019-07-28T13:56:06Z: Magnussen's in the pits, and comes out on a set of softs! Haas takes the gamble.
2019-07-28T13:55:35Z: Leclerc is still cutting the gap to the front, but not quite as dramatically now.
2019-07-28T13:55:01Z: Stroll, meanwhile, passes Magnussen at the hairpin and the Dane decides to fight it all the way - admittedly, to his detriment.
2019-07-28T13:54:57Z: Hamilton's lead over Bottas is 6.2s - with Verstappen now closing back to the second Mercedes.
2019-07-28T13:54:25Z: Looks like the rain is indeed returning - clearly falling in the pitlane.
2019-07-28T13:54:22Z: Sainz's spin has promoted Albon into eighth, Giovinazzi into ninth, and Gasly back into the points.
2019-07-28T13:53:32Z: The Williamses could be a solid bet to take some slicks - they're flitting between the 1m35s and 1m38s, some way slower than the rest of the field save for Magnussen.
2019-07-28T13:52:54Z: Leclerc is taking all sorts of wild lines looking for grip - he's still flying.
2019-07-28T13:52:26Z: Leclerc is now just five seconds off Verstappen and is 12s behind Hamilton - those fresh inters are a real advantage for the Ferrari driver.
2019-07-28T13:52:19Z: Sainz rejoins behind Norris, and now sits 14th after declaring his podium hopes over.
2019-07-28T13:51:58Z: Verstappen is told it could rain soon - starting at the stadium section.
2019-07-28T13:51:30Z: That's Sainz off! He JUST keeps it out of the wall at turn 17 after a spin, and gets going again. Lucky boy!
2019-07-28T13:51:23Z: Vettel is still seventh - but he's not going anywhere fast.
2019-07-28T13:50:11Z: Gasly passes Grosjean now for 11th, having cruised clear of Kvyat.
2019-07-28T13:49:46Z: Leclerc is told he's the fastest driver on track - he's really going for it.
2019-07-28T13:49:23Z: Hulkenberg has used his fresh inters to pass Raikkonen for fifth.
2019-07-28T13:48:41Z: Leclerc sets the fastest lap - he's flying back to the leaders now.
2019-07-28T13:48:27Z: A real in, in, in, in moment for Hulkenberg's stop - just a year after Hamilton's famous radio command. That's why the bollard's there.
2019-07-28T13:48:04Z: Verstappen closed right in on Bottas at the hairpin, but he slide at the apex and Verstappen falls well back from the Mercedes - he remains third.
2019-07-28T13:47:31Z: Verstappen is suddenly all over Bottas!
2019-07-28T13:47:11Z: It's actually looking rather dry in places! The radiowaves will be jam-packed full of slick-talk, but who will blink first?
2019-07-28T13:47:09Z: Replays show the right-front on Leclerc's car was very slow going on, and Hulkenberg only just made it around the bollard to come into the pits.
2019-07-28T13:46:20Z: Leclerc and Hulkenberg basically had a free stop there - although they have lost about five extra seconds to Hamilton.
2019-07-28T13:45:37Z: In the smokescreen, Gasly managed to pass Kvyat. A super-effective move for Gasly there.
2019-07-28T13:45:36Z: The VSC has ended - back to racing.
2019-07-28T13:45:26Z: Leclerc pits under the VSC for fresh inters, as does Hulkenberg - they're P4 and P5
2019-07-28T13:44:47Z: The VSC has been deployed after Ricciardo has stopped.
2019-07-28T13:44:18Z: That's Ricciardo! A huge amount of smoke pours out of the Renault, we've not seen one like that for a while. Day over for the Australian.
2019-07-28T13:43:36Z: Hamilton's lead is now 4.7s over Bottas.
2019-07-28T13:42:22Z: Ferrari has been fined for Leclerc's unsafe release with Grosjean - but no sporting penalty for the driver.
2019-07-28T13:41:42Z: The track is now starting to look very dry - could we see someone gambling for slicks soon?
2019-07-28T13:41:03Z: So after 12 laps, obviously, the order is Hamilton, Bottas, Verstappen, Leclerc, Hulkenberg, Raikkonen, Vettel, Sainz, Albon, Giovinazzi, Grosjean, Ricciardo, Kyvat, Gasly, Norris, Magnussen, Stroll, Russell and Kubica.
2019-07-28T13:39:25Z: Replays show Leclerc nearly losing the rear of his car on the kerb by the drag racing startline at the head of the pit straight - he had to catch a massive slide!
2019-07-28T13:38:27Z: Up front, Hamilton's lead is 2.8s over Bottas - with that gap he's not getting a lot of TV time, which is very understandable.
2019-07-28T13:37:13Z: Gasly's on the tail of Kvyat, gunning for 13th after slipping down the order.
2019-07-28T13:37:03Z: So Vettel has made it up to seventh from the back of the grid, but he's already 29.4s off the lead after 10 laps.
2019-07-28T13:36:26Z: Things have settled down slightly - but there's still a chance of more rain coming shortly.
2019-07-28T13:35:57Z: At the start of lap 10, Hamilton has just set another fastest lap up front.
2019-07-28T13:35:47Z: Magnussen's pitstop elevates Albon and Giovinazzi to 9th and 10th. And with that, everyone's taken a pitstop.
2019-07-28T13:35:28Z: The top three - Hamilton, Bottas and Verstappen - are well clear of Leclerc in fourth.
2019-07-28T13:34:50Z: Magnussen pits for inters - the gamble didn't pay off.
2019-07-28T13:34:00Z: Raikkonen and Vettel have made their way by Magnussen.
2019-07-28T13:33:42Z: Leclerc is under investigation for the unsafe release with Grosjean.
2019-07-28T13:33:28Z: Stroll and Russell also peel in for inters, better late than never.
2019-07-28T13:33:18Z: Hamilton sets another fastest lap - he's trying to romp clear, but the top three are covered by just 3.1s
2019-07-28T13:32:29Z: Now Raikkonen is all over Magnussen with Vettel just behind in P8 - the inters are clearly the tyre to be on right now
2019-07-28T13:32:23Z: Norris comes in for inters, having floundered on the wet rubber.
2019-07-28T13:31:43Z: Hamilton is leading Bottas by 1.4s and just set the fastest lap on lap six of 64.
2019-07-28T13:31:18Z: Wet tyres do not seem like the tyres to be on right now at all. The inter runners are passing those yet to stop with consummate ease. We'd say 'sailing past', but it's drying up a touch.
2019-07-28T13:30:59Z: Hulkenberg pressured Leclerc hard, but the Ferrari has scampered clear.
2019-07-28T13:30:39Z: Leclerc's move on Magnussen has allowed Hulkenberg to pass the Haas and now the Renault is all over the Ferrari.
2019-07-28T13:30:14Z: Vettel's up to tenth too, so the very early pit for inters has paid off rather nicely.
2019-07-28T13:30:12Z: At the start of lap six, Leclerc outdrags Magnussen on the run to Turn 2, but goes deep at the corner and only just stays ahead!
2019-07-28T13:29:44Z: Raikkonen dispatches the Williams pair in short order, and the two begin a steady descent down the order.
2019-07-28T13:29:33Z: Leclerc is up to fifth - but it looks like he may have been involved in an unsafe release in front of Grosjean when he came in for inters, let's see what happens with any investigation
2019-07-28T13:28:51Z: And Verstappen deprives Magnussen of third at the hairpin.
2019-07-28T13:28:27Z: Bottas takes P2 from Magnussen on the run down to the hairpin.
2019-07-28T13:28:08Z: Hamilton drops Magnussen at the restart.
2019-07-28T13:27:50Z: The safety car is coming in - we're racing again
2019-07-28T13:27:14Z: Replays off the start show Leclerc was very aggressive heading into Turn 1 - he dived down the inside of a lot of cars there.
2019-07-28T13:27:10Z: Grosjean, Gasly and co also come in for inters. Stroll and Norris have elected not to stop, and the Williamses have stayed out too.
2019-07-28T13:26:40Z: Magnussen didn't come in - so he's up to second behind Hamilton in the queue behind the safety car.
2019-07-28T13:26:27Z: Nothing Perez could do there, but instead just got an armful of aquaplaning and piled into the wall.
2019-07-28T13:26:08Z: All the leaders are in to change tyres - Verstappen, Raikkonen, Hulkenberg and Leclerc too.
2019-07-28T13:25:47Z: That stop for inters has put Vettel and Albon down to the back of the field.
2019-07-28T13:25:38Z: And Hamilton does pit to fit the the inters, with Bottas in too for the same rubber.
2019-07-28T13:25:09Z: Mercedes have called Hamilton in at the end of this lap - presumably for inters.
2019-07-28T13:24:47Z: Plenty of cars coming in for intermediates - including Vettel.
2019-07-28T13:24:30Z: Perez looks like he spun in backwards - he's out.
2019-07-28T13:24:14Z: Perez is in the wall approaching the stadium! That's a safety car.
2019-07-28T13:23:16Z: Hamilton's lead is already 2.5s over Bottas at the head of the pack.
2019-07-28T13:22:54Z: And Verstappen has now deprived Raikkonen of third place at the hairpin.
2019-07-28T13:22:39Z: Leclerc has made it up to sixth for Ferrari.
2019-07-28T13:22:30Z: Hamilton is well clear of Bottas, with Verstappen now closing in on Raikkonen for third.
2019-07-28T13:22:15Z: Vettel's surged up to 14th too, a great start for the Ferrari ace.
2019-07-28T13:21:56Z: Gasly's dropped all the way down to eighth - a very tentative start for Red Bull!
2019-07-28T13:21:42Z: Hamilton and Bottas are romping clear, pursed by Raikkonen - how very 2014-2018.
2019-07-28T13:21:15Z: Verstappen lost ground off the line - there's action in the pack at the hairpin.
2019-07-28T13:20:40Z: Bottas went wide at Turn 1 - and Raikkonen is up to third
2019-07-28T13:19:29Z: Get ready - the cars are forming up on the grid for a full start.
2019-07-28T13:18:47Z: The lights are off on the safety car.
2019-07-28T13:18:05Z: This will be the last formation lap - the safety car is coming in and there will be a standing start - joys!
2019-07-28T13:17:16Z: And that's a fourth tour for the safety car - but its still a formation lap, and not counting down from the race total.
2019-07-28T13:15:48Z: The safety car is staying out for a third lap at least - this is an attempt to shift the standing water and make things safer for the drivers, as well as get them used to the conditions, and hopefully let them have a standing start.
2019-07-28T13:13:33Z: Conditions look tricky, but raceable - but then we're sitting down in the warm indoors...
2019-07-28T13:12:40Z: And the safety car does indeed lead the pack through for another lap.
2019-07-28T13:12:05Z: The drivers are being told there will be more than one formation lap behind the safety car.
2019-07-28T13:11:22Z: As the cars make their way down to the hairpin there's plenty of spray - but not tonnes of water being chucked up so far.
2019-07-28T13:10:22Z: A full gamut of conditions here at Hockenheim this weekend. Scorching conditions on Friday, and now to begin our first wet race of the season. And if there's anything we're good at, it's talking about weather.
2019-07-28T13:10:17Z: The formation lap is underway at Hockenheim - but the safety car is leading the pack away from the grid
2019-07-28T13:08:56Z: It's confirmed that everyone will start on wets, owing to the safety car formation lap. And if we say 'wet' any more, we owe royalties to a certain 80s Scottish band...
2019-07-28T13:07:22Z: After Ferrari's nightmarish qualifying, Leclerc starts tenth, and Vettel starts from last. But in 2000, Rubens Barrichello won here from 18th on the grid...so all's not lost.
2019-07-28T13:04:42Z: Verstappen had some damage on his way to the grid, requiring a quick fix to a turning vane. Scrutineers have given the a-ok, so he'll be all good to go.
2019-07-28T13:03:05Z: A formation lap is expected behind the safety car, although Mercedes is considering intermediates. Temperature is fine, but the standing water on-track presents an aquaplaning risk.
2019-07-28T13:01:41Z: Hello, and welcome to the Autosport Live feed for the German Grand Prix! And hoo boy, it's actually wet! It's raining, and it's expected to remain for at least another hour into the race.
